result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis L. Boschult was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months.

Criminal Case Settlement

Cases 15CF337 & 16CF196 called at 3:31 pm [sf]
Defendant Curtis L. Boschult in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock advises that there is victim rights compliance.
Court so finds.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Count #2 in case 15CF337; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1 in 15CF337 & case 16CF196.
Court reads the victim impact statement submitted by the State.

Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions [as noted in the criminal case settlement, which are as follows]:
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--Any other assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--Maintain Absolute Sobriety; no presence in bars, taverns- at discretion of agent
--Complete Certified Batterer Intervention Program - at discretion of agent
--No contact with Holly Boschult unless both she and the supervising agent approve in advance
--No possession of any dangerous weapons including firearms
--to pay statutory costs
--reimbursement of court appointed attorney fees

Days credit for time already served: 2 days
recess: 3:56 pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Case called at 9:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Curtis L. Boschult in court with Attorney Jordan Lippert. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck confirms victim rights compliance; Court so finds

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Boschult waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
Atty Lippert requests that the arraignment be held at later date. Mr. Boschult has another matter 16CF196 also pending in this Court, which is set for PTC and STC, would request that this matter track with that and that this case be set for DA PTC and Arraignment/STC at the same date and time as the other matter. Not officially appointed in the 16CF196 case and would request to also be appointed in that matter at this time as Mr. Boschult's finances have not changed. 
Court appoints Atty Lippert in 16CF196 and grants scheduling request, upon no objection from the State. Court orders repayment of Atty fees in 16CF196 to be combined with repayment in 15CF337

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:20 pm [sf]
Defendant Curtis L. Boschult in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office . Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney De La Rosa advises that they appear for bond purposes only.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No direct contact with Holly Boschult; indirect contact will be limited to written contact, nonthreatening in nature and having to do with child custody and placement issues only.
-Not to possess any dangerous weapons as defined by statute
-No presence at the residence at 824 N. Main St. For tAtkinson, except may return one time within the next 72 hours with law enforcement to pick up his possessions

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Recess: 1:25 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 10/28/15 at 10:40 am
Status: 12/15/15 at 9:00 am
